required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Video Intervention on Postabortal Uptake of Long Acting Reversible Contraception (LARC)

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock:
Primary: To compare rates of immediate postabortal LARC uptake between women exposed to a brief, theory-based, video intervention prior to standard contraceptive counseling and women exposed to standard counseling alone.
Secondary: To identify predictors of immediate postabortal LARC uptake among all participants including the role of:
- Demographic and reproductive health history variables
- Baseline decisional balance, self-efficacy and stage of change for contraceptive initiation

detailed_description.textblock: This is a randomized controlled trial evaluating the effect of a brief video intervention on postabortal uptake of long acting reversible contraception.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Caregiver), Primary Purpose: Health Services Research

primary_outcome.description: Immediate uptake of IUD or contraceptive implant following surgical abortion

secondary_outcome.measure: Perceived self efficacy surrounding LARC decision making
secondary_outcome.description: Subject's own perception of her ability to uptake LARC in the postabortal period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Perceived decisional balance surrounding LARC decision making
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects perceived pros and cons around starting a LARC method in the postabortal period

secondary_outcome.measure: Stage of behavioral change around LARC uptake

arm_group.description: Participants will view a seven - minute theory-based video of patient testimonials about their own postabortal LARC uptake.
Patients will view a 7 minute video about stress management delivered by local psychologist.

intervention.description: Brief 7 minute video of physician describing LARC methods followed by two patient testimonials about their own postabortal LARC experience.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Ages 18 - 29 Surgical abortion being performed the day of the study English speaking
Exclusion Criteria:
- Nonviable pregnancy Sexual assault Administered sedative medication Non English speaking
